conclusion: Analyze the equilibrium of the system to solve for forces F1 and F2.
Identify forces: gravitational force mg, tension T, normal forces F1 and F2.
Resolve forces into components along x-axis and y-axis due to 45° angle.
For x-axis: F1 = T/√2 due to equilibrium.
For y-axis: F2 = mg - T/√2 due to equilibrium.
Determine tension T using equilibrium conditions.
Substitute T into y-axis equation: F2 = mg - F1.
Final relationships: F1 = T/√2, F2 = mg - T/√2.
